name: sambucus racemosa
description: New!  Unlike the edible blue-black berries of Sambucus canadensis (Elderberry), the red-berries of this Sambucus are mildly poisonous. Also called Sambucus pubens. Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Spring (April-May).This bare root tree is 2 years old and we trim to a height of approximately 18-24".
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
